text: Wahoo (Acanthocybium solandri) is a scombrid fish found worldwide in tropical and subtropical seas. It is best known to sports fishermen, as its speed and high-quality flesh makes it a prized and valued game fish. In Hawaii, the wahoo is known as ono. The species is sometimes called hoo in the United States. Wahoo can also mean a term for excitement. == Description == These fish have slender bodies and have large mouths. Some specimens can reach up to 2.5 metres (8 ft 2 in) in length and also weighing up to 83 kilograms (183 lb). The growth of this fish can be quite quick. == Related pages == * List of fish common names == References == Category:Scombriformes == Other websites ==
title: Wahoo
